trans-unit.source: Create Hadoop, HBase, or Storm clusters on Linux in HDInsight using the cross-platform Azure CLI | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Create Hadoop, HBase, or Storm clusters on Linux in HDInsight using the cross-platform Azure CLI | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to create Linux-based HDInsight clusters using the cross-platform Azure CLI, Azure Resource Manager templates, and the Azure REST API.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to create Linux-based HDInsight clusters using the cross-platform Azure CLI, Azure Resource Manager templates, and the Azure REST API.

trans-unit.source: You can specify the cluster type (Hadoop, HBase, or Storm,) or use scripts to install custom components..
trans-unit.target: You can specify the cluster type (Hadoop, HBase, or Storm,) or use scripts to install custom components..

trans-unit.source: Create Linux-based clusters in HDInsight using the Azure CLI
trans-unit.target: Create Linux-based clusters in HDInsight using the Azure CLI

trans-unit.source: The Azure CLI is a cross-platform command-line utility that allows you to manage Azure Services.
trans-unit.target: The Azure CLI is a cross-platform command-line utility that allows you to manage Azure Services.

trans-unit.source: It can be used, along with Azure Resource management templates, to create an HDInsight cluster, along with associated storage accounts and other services.
trans-unit.target: It can be used, along with Azure Resource management templates, to create an HDInsight cluster, along with associated storage accounts and other services.

trans-unit.source: Azure Resource Management templates are JSON documents that describe a __resource group__ and all resources in it (such as HDInsight.) This template based approach allows you to define all the resources that you need for HDInsight in one template, and to manage changes to the group as a whole through __deployments__ that apply changes to the group.
trans-unit.target: Azure Resource Management templates are JSON documents that describe a __resource group__ and all resources in it (such as HDInsight.) This template based approach allows you to define all the resources that you need for HDInsight in one template, and to manage changes to the group as a whole through __deployments__ that apply changes to the group.

trans-unit.source: The steps in this document walk through the process of creating a new HDInsight cluster using the Azure CLI and a template.
trans-unit.target: The steps in this document walk through the process of creating a new HDInsight cluster using the Azure CLI and a template.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] The steps in this document use the default number of worker nodes (4) for an HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] The steps in this document use the default number of worker nodes (4) for an HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: If you plan on more than 32 worker nodes, either at cluster creation or by scaling the cluster after creation, then you must select a head node size with at least 8 cores and 14GB ram.
trans-unit.target: If you plan on more than 32 worker nodes, either at cluster creation or by scaling the cluster after creation, then you must select a head node size with at least 8 cores and 14GB ram.

trans-unit.source: For more information on node sizes and associated costs, see [HDInsight pricing](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/hdinsight/).
trans-unit.target: For more information on node sizes and associated costs, see [HDInsight pricing](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/hdinsight/).

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: **An Azure subscription**.
trans-unit.target: **An Azure subscription**.

trans-unit.source: See [Get Azure free trial](https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/videos/get-azure-free-trial-for-testing-hadoop-in-hdinsight/).
trans-unit.target: See [Get Azure free trial](https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/videos/get-azure-free-trial-for-testing-hadoop-in-hdinsight/).

trans-unit.source: __Azure CLI__.
trans-unit.target: __Azure CLI__.

trans-unit.source: For information on installing the CLI, see [Install the Azure CLI](../xplat-cli-install.md).
trans-unit.target: For information on installing the CLI, see [Install the Azure CLI](../xplat-cli-install.md).

trans-unit.source: Login to your Azure subscription
trans-unit.target: Login to your Azure subscription

trans-unit.source: Follow the steps documented in [Connect to an Azure subscription from the Azure Command-Line Interface (Azure CLI)](../xplat-cli-connect.md) and connect to your subscription using the __login__ method.
trans-unit.target: Follow the steps documented in [Connect to an Azure subscription from the Azure Command-Line Interface (Azure CLI)](../xplat-cli-connect.md) and connect to your subscription using the __login__ method.

trans-unit.source: Create a cluster
trans-unit.target: Create a cluster

trans-unit.source: The following steps should be performed from a command-prompt, shell or terminal session after installing and configuring the Azure CLI.
trans-unit.target: The following steps should be performed from a command-prompt, shell or terminal session after installing and configuring the Azure CLI.

trans-unit.source: Use the following command to authenticate to your Azure subscription:
trans-unit.target: Use the following command to authenticate to your Azure subscription:

trans-unit.source: You will be prompted to provide your name and password.
trans-unit.target: You will be prompted to provide your name and password.

trans-unit.source: If you have multiple Azure subscriptions, you can use `azure account set <subscriptionname>` to set the subscription that the Azure CLI commands will use.
trans-unit.target: If you have multiple Azure subscriptions, you can use `azure account set <subscriptionname>` to set the subscription that the Azure CLI commands will use.

trans-unit.source: Switch to Azure Resource Manager mode using the following command:
trans-unit.target: Switch to Azure Resource Manager mode using the following command:

trans-unit.source: Create a template for your HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: Create a template for your HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: The following are some basic example templates:
trans-unit.target: The following are some basic example templates:

trans-unit.source: [Linux-based cluster, using an SSH public key](https://github.com/Azure/azure-quickstart-templates/tree/master/hdinsight-linux-ssh-publickey)
trans-unit.target: [Linux-based cluster, using an SSH public key](https://github.com/Azure/azure-quickstart-templates/tree/master/hdinsight-linux-ssh-publickey)

trans-unit.source: [Linux-based cluster, using a password for the SSH account](https://github.com/Azure/azure-quickstart-templates/tree/master/hdinsight-linux-ssh-password)
trans-unit.target: [Linux-based cluster, using a password for the SSH account](https://github.com/Azure/azure-quickstart-templates/tree/master/hdinsight-linux-ssh-password)

trans-unit.source: Both of these templates also create the default Azure Storage Account used by HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: Both of these templates also create the default Azure Storage Account used by HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: The files you will need are the __azuredeploy.json__ and __azuredeploy.parameters.json__.
trans-unit.target: The files you will need are the __azuredeploy.json__ and __azuredeploy.parameters.json__.

trans-unit.source: Copy these files locally before continuing.
trans-unit.target: Copy these files locally before continuing.

trans-unit.source: Open the __azuredeploy.parameters.json__ file in an editor, and provide values for the items in the `parameters` section:
trans-unit.target: Open the __azuredeploy.parameters.json__ file in an editor, and provide values for the items in the `parameters` section:

trans-unit.source: __location__: The data center that the resources will be created in.
trans-unit.target: __location__: The data center that the resources will be created in.

trans-unit.source: You can view the `location` section in the __azuredeploy.json__ file for a list of allowed locations.
trans-unit.target: You can view the `location` section in the __azuredeploy.json__ file for a list of allowed locations.

trans-unit.source: __clusterName__: The name of the HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: __clusterName__: The name of the HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: This name must be unique, or the deployment will fail.
trans-unit.target: This name must be unique, or the deployment will fail.

trans-unit.source: __clusterStorageAccountName__: The name of the Azure Storage Account that will be created for the HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: __clusterStorageAccountName__: The name of the Azure Storage Account that will be created for the HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: This name must be unique, or the deployment will fail.
trans-unit.target: This name must be unique, or the deployment will fail.

trans-unit.source: __clusterLoginPassword__: The password for the cluster admin user.
trans-unit.target: __clusterLoginPassword__: The password for the cluster admin user.

trans-unit.source: This should be a secure password, as it is used to access web sites and REST services on the cluster.
trans-unit.target: This should be a secure password, as it is used to access web sites and REST services on the cluster.

trans-unit.source: __sshUserName__: The name of the first SSH user to create for this cluster.
trans-unit.target: __sshUserName__: The name of the first SSH user to create for this cluster.

trans-unit.source: SSH will be used to remotely access the cluster using this account.
trans-unit.target: SSH will be used to remotely access the cluster using this account.

trans-unit.source: __sshPublicKey__: If you are using the template that requires an SSH public key, you must add your public key on this line.
trans-unit.target: __sshPublicKey__: If you are using the template that requires an SSH public key, you must add your public key on this line.

trans-unit.source: For more information on generating and working with public keys, see the following articles:
trans-unit.target: For more information on generating and working with public keys, see the following articles:

trans-unit.source: [Use SSH with Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight from Linux, Unix, or OS X](hdinsight-hadoop-linux-use-ssh-unix.md)
trans-unit.target: [Use SSH with Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight from Linux, Unix, or OS X](hdinsight-hadoop-linux-use-ssh-unix.md)

trans-unit.source: [Use SSH with Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight from Windows](hdinsight-hadoop-linux-use-ssh-windows.md)
trans-unit.target: [Use SSH with Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight from Windows](hdinsight-hadoop-linux-use-ssh-windows.md)

trans-unit.source: __sshPassword__: If you are using the template that requires an SSH password, you must add a password on this line.
trans-unit.target: __sshPassword__: If you are using the template that requires an SSH password, you must add a password on this line.

trans-unit.source: Once you are done, save and close the file.
trans-unit.target: Once you are done, save and close the file.

trans-unit.source: Use the following to create an empty resource group.
trans-unit.target: Use the following to create an empty resource group.

trans-unit.source: Replace __RESOURCEGROUPNAME__ with the name you wish to use for this group.
trans-unit.target: Replace __RESOURCEGROUPNAME__ with the name you wish to use for this group.

trans-unit.source: Replace __LOCATION__ with the data center that you want to create your HDInsight cluster in:
trans-unit.target: Replace __LOCATION__ with the data center that you want to create your HDInsight cluster in:

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] If the location name contains spaces, put it in quotes.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] If the location name contains spaces, put it in quotes.

trans-unit.source: For example "South Central US".
trans-unit.target: For example "South Central US".

trans-unit.source: Use the following command to create the initial deployment for this resource group.
trans-unit.target: Use the following command to create the initial deployment for this resource group.

trans-unit.source: Replace __PATHTOTEMPLATE__ with the path to the __azuredeploy.json__ template file.
trans-unit.target: Replace __PATHTOTEMPLATE__ with the path to the __azuredeploy.json__ template file.

trans-unit.source: Replace __PATHTOPARAMETERSFILE__ with the path to the __azuredeploy.parameters.json__ file.
trans-unit.target: Replace __PATHTOPARAMETERSFILE__ with the path to the __azuredeploy.parameters.json__ file.

trans-unit.source: Replace __RESOURCEGROUPNAME__ with the name of the group you created in the previous step:
trans-unit.target: Replace __RESOURCEGROUPNAME__ with the name of the group you created in the previous step:

trans-unit.source: Once the deployment has been accepted, you should see a message similar to `group deployment create command ok`.
trans-unit.target: Once the deployment has been accepted, you should see a message similar to `group deployment create command ok`.

trans-unit.source: It may take some time for the deployment to complete, around 15 minutes.
trans-unit.target: It may take some time for the deployment to complete, around 15 minutes.

trans-unit.source: you can view information about the deployment using the following command.
trans-unit.target: you can view information about the deployment using the following command.

trans-unit.source: Replace __RESOURCEGROUPNAME__ with the name of the resource group used in the previous step:
trans-unit.target: Replace __RESOURCEGROUPNAME__ with the name of the resource group used in the previous step:

trans-unit.source: Once the deployment completes, the __Status__ field will contain the value __Succeeded__.
trans-unit.target: Once the deployment completes, the __Status__ field will contain the value __Succeeded__.

trans-unit.source: If a failure occurs during deployment, you can get more information on the failure using the following command
trans-unit.target: If a failure occurs during deployment, you can get more information on the failure using the following command
